COMMENT_TX: Carlson backed up Williams' throw past Huber, but his throw to catch Stock off 1B sailed over Holke to the stands.
Huber first tried to tag Stock, then hurriedly threw high to 1B, pulling Holke off the bag.
Startling running catch near the flagpole
Mitchell knocked down the drive but threw in time
Hit the YMCA sign in CF
A thunderstorm broke out before PHI batted; 20-minute delay. The field became muddy, making handling the ball difficult.
Grounder skidded in the mud and went through Sand
High took throw to 1B but missed bag
Short wild pitch, runner on third held

ej,fourj101,P,mclap901,Fighting ej,meyeb103,C,mclap901,Fighting $as Jack Fournier returned to his position, Phillies 1B coach Benny Meyer said something, causing Fournier to rush at Myers; they started fighting and both benches cleared; Fournier and Meyer ejected by HP umpire Peter McLaughlin NL President Heydler was present and witnessed the brawl. Afterwards Fournier said Myers had insulted Dazzy Vance in Tuesday's game, and today directed the insults to him. Game was delayed 10 minutes.
Tremendous drive far over RCF wall
ML debuts for Andy Rush and Dick Cox
Missing 1st page of NYEW coverage; 2nd page begins here

In honor of the late Charles Ebbetts both teams and managers lined up around the plate in a crescent for a minute of silence before the game.  The CF flag was at half-mast and all players wore black arm bands.
Diving try by Cox ruled a trap by Ump Klem; arguments ensued
Hard slide by Youngs broke up DP possibility; Robins claimed interference.
Petty's awkward toss allowed Kelly take 3B
Terry wrenched his sore ankle going into 2B and was helped off the field.
Over RF wall, just above the sign: 'The hit of Brooklyn'
Low throw to 1B; Johnston just beat Kelly's throw home
Grimes' pickoff throw got away from High and rolled into CF
Spectacular running catch up against railing of RF stands
High throw pulled Burrus off bag
Johnny Mitchell was out of the BRO lineup with a sore hand
Easy fly that Mann could've caught in his hip pocket, but Padgett called him off and missed it.
Ogrodowski's ML debut (and only career appearance)
A belated May Day riot caused two fans to be ejected from the stands in the 3rd.
The crowd swarmed the field as he rounded 3B.  Jack and two policemen made a path to the plate.  The crowd then tried to pick him up after crossing home but he escaped after much struggling.
Zitzmann hurt his ankle sliding into 2B
Line drive over the drawn-in infield
Mitchell was caught between 1B & 2B and run down
NYEW reported Pinelli tagged Loftus between 3B & home
Hit top of CF fence; missed HR by 2'
DWS: No CS on error in 1925

ej,luqud101,P,riglc901,HBP (Threw bat) $Dolph Luque hit on the ribs; he threw his bat at Tiny Osborne and they ran at each other; HP umpire Cy Rigler got between the players as both benches cleared; Luque ejected by Rigler
Over RF wall, into Bedford Avenue
Fournier couldn't play due to a sore hand
Mueller missed shoestring catch, then threw wild to 3B.
During Mueller's AB, Taylor argued a called ball and was ejected by Ump Pfirman.
The throw had Wheat by 10' but Bell dropped it
Ball bounced off Bottomley's shins to Hornsby

The game was delayed while Umpire Sweeney directed Mgr Rickey to keep all but the next 2 batters on the bench. It was a thrilling argument and served only to delay what was already a very slow game.  After several minutes Sweeney went to consult with O'Day about the rules regarding the occasion.  Apparently Sweeney won the argument as only Bottomley and Bell were allowed to stand alongside of the bench while Hornsby was hitting.

Ump Sweeney called the batter out on a quick pitch while Douthit was three or four feet out of the batter's box. NYT: 'Hubbell struck out Douthit with two quick delivery pitches...Douthit maintained he was not in the batter's box when the last one was made.' SLS: 'It is probable this game will be protested.'
Hafey fell trying to field the easy fly; it rolled to fence
Robbed of HR when Wheat leaned over LF bleacher fence. Cards argued Wheat had left the playing field to make the catch.
Cooney failed to touch the bag
DeBerry was spiked on left foot, colliding with Johnston; time was called while the wound was dressed.
Wide throw to 1B trying for DP
Stock fumbled long enough to allow Pie to score
Gooch let Cuyler's throw get away
Grimes was trapped between 1B & 2B but Moore's throw to Grantham hit Grimes in the back.

NL's Golden Jubilee flag was raised before the game; Landis and NL Pres Heydler attended; both teams paraded to the pole for the flag raising headed by Shannon's Band; Dazzy Vance received a medal and $1000 in gold as 1924's MVP; many old-timers in attendance.
Stock made a fine recovery and almost got Grantham
PGT: Hit in the leg.   NYT: Hit in the ribs.
Got away from Carey and rolled to the exit gate
Grantham's relay to the plate was high
Just missed bounding into the seats
Carey leaped for the bounding ball but failed to hold it
Hot drive bounded poorly for Brown
Stock lost it in the sun
Great baserunning by Traynor; Wheat fumbled momentarily and when he threw to 2B to hold Wright at 1B, Traynor streaked around 3B and beat the throw home.
Looked at 3rd strike after fouling off a bunt
Threw high to 1B trying for DP; Moore charged with error though it seemed as if Niehaus should've held onto it.
Smith's foul tip hit Taylor on left foot and he left game
Thrilling pickup by Traynor NYEW coverage ended here
During the AB Barnhart hit a liner just foul down LF line
Traynor went to 3B on the hit and scored when Johnston threw past Stock trying to get Wright.
Tremendous applause for Griffith as he stepped to bat
ej,grimc101,P,wilsf901,Called third strike Grimm ejected by Ump Wilson for protesting the third strike
Easy pop fly fell between Stock and Cox

Stock dropped the ball but Ump Moran ruled Heathcote knocked it out of his hands and called him out for interference. Robins argued Adams should've been sent back to 2B.  Stock was charged with error for allowing Adams to go to 3B.
ej,fribb101,P,morac102,Call at 1B $When Hartnett threw to 1B to catch Loftus asleep, the runner overran 1B, but Ump Moran ruled he was safe.  Friberg kicked and was ejected by Moran.
Grimm hadn't started due to sore left foot
Game started early to allow Cubs to make their train

BOUNCE HR? CDT: Wheat was playing with his back to the barrier, but was too close to the foul line, so while he was galloping across the field the ball came down and bounced over the low fence in front of the LF bleachers.
Mueller let it bound over him

----------Game Called...Rain---------- play,6,0,belll101,??,,S8 play,6,0,sherb101,??,,D9/F9DW.1-H play,6,0,bladr102,20,,MP $With 2 balls to Blades rain came and the game was called reverting back to the 5th inning.
Wilson climbed the concrete wall attempting to catch it
Through Terry's legs but Youngs recovered
PDL: BOUNCE HR; long drive bounded over the low LCF fence NYT: Into LF circus seats
Bancroft hit a foul off his right instep and took time out. He then limped back to the plate and hit a double.
Benton tried to score when Cox fumbled
Youngs muffed it after colliding with Southworth
Southworth had entered the game riding a charley horse
Infield fly rule; when it dropped safely in front of Kelly, Osborne tried to score.
One of the longest/hardest ever made here
Bancroft got a glove on it
Grounder off Stock's chest; hurried throw was wild
ej,grimb101,P,mclap901,Balls and strikes (Pushed umpire) Burleigh Grimes ejected by HP umpire Peter McLaughlin
All 3 sparkling outfield catches in 9th saved HRs
Wild throw past Burrus trying for DP
Gibson tried to score when Brown's throw got away from DeBerry who made a quick recovery and tossed to Ehrhardt.
Maranville's first game as Cubs Mgr; replaced Killefer
Attempted double steal.  One umpire called safe, the other out.  Cubs raised a mighty roar on the final decision.
Ball struck squarely atop RF wall and back onto the field
Over RF wall, into Bedford Avenue
Oeschger tried to double Heathcote but threw wide of 1B
Pretty pickup but threw low; Grantham couldn't scoop it
Daring baserunning by Traynor on hard hit
Fearing Cuyler's arm, Stock was held at 3B
Cox hurt himself crashing into the wall
Bad hop twisted away from Stock
Close play at 1B on Moore's DP try
0-2 pitch to Wheat was a fastball on the outside corner that was called a ball by Klem; Gooch protested.
ej,mckeb101,M,klemb901,Balls and strikes $Mgr McKechnie ejected by Ump Klem for protesting the pitch to Wheat before his triple; Rawlings went to 1B coach's box.
Just missed HR. With a 3-2 count, Taylor couldn't hold Barnhart's foul tip.
Got by Cox and rolled on
High bounder over Grimes, perfect throw; Taylor dropped it
Texas Leaguer; Traynor started for it then retraced his steps in time to take Barnhart's throw and tag Loftus diving into 3B.
1-handed stop behind 2B; robbed of a hit
Stock beat the return throw to 1B; it appeared Grantham could have stepped on 1B and still thrown out Cox at 2B, allowing Wright enough time for the tag.
Cox lost it in the sun
Robbed of a hit on the edge of the RF grass

Cox lost another one in the sun, but his return throw to 3B was a close play as Cuyler overslid the bag.  When Ump Klem called him safe, Tierney hurled his glove to the ground, stamped on it, and did everything but chew the thumb off.  A shower of pop bottles were thrown at Ump Klem, too.
Cox had trouble with this one as well
BOUNCE HR into LF bleachers; Bigbee tried to reach the high fly before it 1-hopped into the bleachers but could not.
Whirlwind bare-hand pickup of high bounder but Pie beat the throw.
Cox wore a stronger pair of smoked glasses today after misplaying 3 flies in the sun yesterday.
$Fine pickup but throw pulled Grantham off 1B (according to Ump McCormick).  Entire Pirate infield protested.
Wright apparently thought the side was retired and did not attempt a DP throw to 1B.
Fournier had tried to bunt before flying out
Aldridge failed to get 2 bunts down before fanning
After robbing Kiki of a single Stock threw low to the stands
Bounder took a high hop over Stock
Caromed off Vance's shins to Stock
High throw back to 1B on DP try
Through Fournier but Stock backed him up
Moore had a chance to double up Cox but threw wide to Wright and was charged with an error.
BOUNCE HR; over Walker, into CF bleachers on first bounce
Critz threw to 1B from a horizontal position.
Ball hit bag and bounced away from Tierney

Great play; made a flying grab at the ball, wheeled in the air, and tossed him out.  It was a hard stop and a harder throw; from his awkward position he had to bounce the ball to 1B, but it was a perfect bounce.
Roush slid back into 2B and beat Tierney's throw
Over RF wall; fair by inches

SLS: Reinhart dropped Hornsby's throw. NYEW: S3/G -- bounced a single off Bottomley's shins. NYT: Fournier made a brilliant three-cushion shot; he banked off Bottomley's shins, caromed off Hornsby's glove, and then Reinhart dropped it at 1B.
BOUNCE HR into LF bleachers after long hop off the hard turf
Missed a HR by a foot
First two innings were played in 10 minutes
NYTEM coverage continued on P.13 (unavailable for review)
Close play at home; 5 minutes of protests by SLN followed
17 Ks set new record for 10 inning game
Vance first failed to bunt before singling
Wonderful 1-handed catch robbed him of triple
Broken-bat single; 18-game hitting streak for Cox
Thrilling stop prevented a run; fast play
PGT: BOUNCE HR, into LCF seats on one hop
Texas Leaguer fell between Wright & Cuyler
Gooch turned towards 2B and was tagged out by Fournier
Pie stretched it to a double
Cuyler's fast fielding held Brown at 2B
Wright couldn't field it cleanly but recovered for the force
Gooch caught the entire game with a bandaged hand
The ball became mixed up in the bullpen
NYTEM coverage ended here. It continued on p.12 but was unavailable for review; had more detail than other sources.
Bad hop bounced over Barnhart's shoulder
NYEW reported error during Ford AB
Attempted double steal; Taylor bluffed a throw to 2B and tagged Rawlings.
Sensational running 1-handed catch; great ovation for Cuyler
Grounder past Stock took a bad hop over Brown to CF fence
Running catch as he crashed into the concrete barrier
NYT: Tierney's first fielding chance in 31 innings
Stock overran 3B due to poor coaching by Loftus
Earlier in this AB Fournier drove a long foul over RF fence
The ball played hide & seek with a policeman in LF corner
Brown's advance aided by Adams' high throw to the plate
Ford got a glove on it
ej,heatc101,P,wilsf901,Balls and strikes (Threw bat) Heathcote was ejected by Ump Wilson for kicking on a called strike during this AB; he threw down his bat, stamped his feet, and said some words.
ej,hartg103,P,wilsf901,Balls and strikes Hartnett ejected for protesting Ump Wilson's decision

Jahn lost it in the sun. During Johnston's AB, the Cubs' bench became noisy.  Ump Wilson stopped the game and ejected 8 or 9 players from the Cub bench whom he suspected of riding him excessively.  The only men left were Maranville, Alexander, Griffith, Churry, and Coach Gibson.
Both players slid into the base and Grimm's right leg was badly spiked.
Michaels, one of the ejected players, was called in from the stands and allowed to return to the field.
Over RF wall; he hit a slow pitch
Brown was running with the pitch and would've been out had it not been ball four.  Sothoron argued with Ump Sweeney.
Through Smith's hands to CF bleachers
Hit the top of the fence and bounded back
Stock took the liner sitting down
ej,bladr102,P,odayh101,Called third strike (Threw bat) Blades kicked on Ump O'Day's decision then threw his bat into the Cardinals' bench; he was EJECTED by O'Day.
Roush was chased back to 3B by DeBerry; Zitzmann was caught returning to 2B.
DeBerry was spiked by Critz on play at the plate
Holke tried to beat Fournier to the bag instead of tossing to Donohue covering.
Running, stumbling 1-handed catch; Roush was halfway to 3B
DeBerry was struck on the left knee cap by a Cooney foul
Great running catch; splendid off-balance heave
Off Kamp's glove; Bancroft dashed in, scooped it up, and shot a high underhand throw to Burrus who made a stretching 1-hand catch.  A gem of a play.
Gibson fell into a box near the Robins' dugout for an almost impossible catch.
The only AB in which Vance allowed 3 balls to any batter
PDL: Grimes caught it with his bare hand
Wicked drive hit Grimes' left leg and knocked him down.  The ball bounced back to Taylor whose throw to 1B was late. Time was called; after about 5 minutes Grimes resumed.
Grimes hopped painfully in the air to grab high bounder
Sand fumbled momentarily from deep SS, costing DP chance
Hargreaves' 1st career game at 1B.  The 2nd game of the doubleheader would be his 2nd and last at 1B.

Harper & Hargreaves collided again and nearly came to blows. Hargreaves contended Harper gave him an elbow in the 5th and returned the favor here with a hip. Harper was greeted with a shower of pop bottles as he went to LF, delaying the game several minutes.
High went to 2B on Brown's fumble but got greedy
Carlson backed up Williams' throw past Huber, but his throw to catch Stock off 1B sailed over Holke to the stands.
Huber first tried to tag Stock, then hurriedly threw high to 1B, pulling Holke off the bag.
